author: cnbc.com
title: Daily Journal: Fiscal 2Q Earnings Snapshot
text:
LOS ANGELES (AP) _ Daily Journal Corp. (DJCO) on Tuesday reported a fiscal second-quarter loss of $232,000, after reporting a profit in the same period a year earlier.
On a per-share basis, the Los Angeles-based company said it had a loss of 17 cents.
The newspaper publisher posted revenue of $9.3 million in the period.
Daily Journal shares have decreased slightly more than 2 percent since the beginning of the year. The stock has risen 8 percent in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on DJCO at https://www.zacks.com/ap/DJCO
